COMPLEX: The gender identities one may identify as include male, female, both, somewhere in between ("third gender"), or neither.
ELEMENTARY: People can identify as male, female, both, in between, or no gender at all.
SECONDARY: Someone can be male, female, a blend of both, somewhere in between, or neither at all.
ADVANCED: Individuals may identify as male, female, both, somewhere in between (often called a 'third gender'), or neither.

COMPLEX: On June 2, 1986, Young was drafted by the Cincinnati Reds in the 22nd round of the amateur draft but did not sign to play Minor League Baseball with Cincinnati, opting instead to enroll at Mississippi State, where he developed as a pitcher.
ELEMENTARY: Young was chosen by the Cincinnati Reds in 1986. But he didn't sign with them. He went to Mississippi State and became a pitcher.
SECONDARY: In 1986, Young was drafted by the Cincinnati Reds but decided to enroll at Mississippi State instead, where he developed as a pitcher.
ADVANCED: On June 2, 1986, Young was drafted in the 22nd round by the Cincinnati Reds but chose to attend Mississippi State, where he honed his pitching skills.

COMPLEX: Most statisticians work in offices and have regular working hours, and can therefore be considered white-collar workers.

ADVANCED: Because most statisticians work in offices with standard hours, they are generally regarded as white-collar workers.

ADVANCED: Jörmungandr will emerge from the sea, contaminating land and water with his venom and driving the waves to batter the shore.

COMPLEX: When a stimulus is applied to a sensory receptor, it elicits or influences a reflex via stimulus transduction.
ELEMENTARY: A signal hits a sensory receptor. This triggers or changes a reflex.
SECONDARY: When a stimulus reaches a sensory receptor, it sparks or alters a reflex through a process called stimulus transduction.
ADVANCED: Applying a stimulus to a sensory receptor activates or modifies a reflex through the mechanism of stimulus transduction.

COMPLEX: It varies in intensity; good-quality oregano is so strong that it almost numbs the tongue, but cultivars adapted to colder climates often have an unsatisfactory flavor.
ELEMENTARY: Oregano's strength can differ. The best kind can almost numb your tongue. But oregano grown in cold places can taste weak.
SECONDARY: The strength of oregano can vary. High-quality oregano can nearly numb the tongue, while cold-climate varieties often lack flavor.
ADVANCED: Oregano's intensity varies; premium varieties can nearly numb the tongue, whereas those adapted to colder regions often have inferior flavor.

COMPLEX: They are characterized by possessing a set of hollow, fixed fangs through which they inject venom, and they come in a wide range of sizes, from 18 cm (Drysdalia) to 6 m in length (Ophiophagus).
ELEMENTARY: They have hollow fangs for injecting venom. They can be as short as 18 cm or as long as 6 m.
SECONDARY: They possess hollow, fixed fangs for venom delivery and range in size from 18 cm (Drysdalia) to 6 m (Ophiophagus).
ADVANCED: These snakes are defined by hollow, fixed fangs used to inject venom, and their sizes range from 18 cm (Drysdalia) up to 6 m (Ophiophagus).

COMPLEX: The exponential function exactly maps all lines not parallel to the real or imaginary axis in the complex plane to all logarithmic spirals in the complex plane with centre at 0.
ELEMENTARY: The exponential function changes certain lines into spirals around zero in the complex plane.
SECONDARY: In the complex plane, the exponential function turns any line not parallel to the axes into a logarithmic spiral centered at zero.
ADVANCED: Within the complex plane, the exponential function precisely transforms all non-parallel lines into logarithmic spirals centered at 0.

COMPLEX: In general, Goodman continued to play in the swing style he was most known for.

ADVANCED: In general, Goodman persisted in the swing style for which he was best known.

COMPLEX: The licenses have fewer restrictions on distribution compared to other free software licenses, such as the GNU General Public License or even the default restrictions provided by copyright, putting works licensed under them relatively closer to the public domain.

ADVANCED: Francisco 'Paco' José Camarasa Castellar (born 27 September 1967) is a former Spanish footballer who predominantly played as a central defender.

COMPLEX: In 1937, Shannon went on to write a master's thesis at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, in which he showed how Boolean algebra could optimize the design of electromechanical relay systems, then used in telephone routing switches.
ELEMENTARY: In 1937, Shannon wrote a master's thesis at MIT. He showed how Boolean algebra could help design relay systems for telephone switches.
SECONDARY: In 1937, Shannon completed a master's thesis at MIT demonstrating how Boolean algebra could improve electromechanical relay systems used in telephone networks.
ADVANCED: In 1937, Shannon authored a master's thesis at MIT revealing how Boolean algebra could optimize electromechanical relay systems for telephone routing.

COMPLEX: He concluded that she was progressing to the point of addiction but also noted that she could give up the drugs for extended periods without suffering withdrawal symptoms.

ADVANCED: He concluded she was nearing addiction, yet he observed that she could abstain for extended intervals without withdrawal symptoms.

COMPLEX: Such phrases and clichés as 'ace in the hole,' 'ace up one's sleeve,' 'beats me,' 'blue chip,' 'call one's bluff,' 'cash in,' 'high roller,' 'pass the buck,' 'poker face,' 'stack up,' 'up the ante,' 'when the chips are down,' 'wild card,' and others are used in everyday conversation, even by those unaware of their origins at the poker table.
ELEMENTARY: Many everyday sayings come from poker, like 'ace in the hole' or 'call one's bluff.' People use them without knowing their origin.
SECONDARY: Common expressions such as 'ace in the hole' and 'poker face' originate from poker, yet most people don't realize their roots lie at the card table.
ADVANCED: Expressions like 'ace in the hole,' 'up the ante,' and 'wild card' stem from poker and are widely used in daily speech by those unaware of their gambling origins.

COMPLEX: Today, the decision on whether non-Muslims should be allowed to enter mosques varies. With few exceptions, mosques in the Arabian Peninsula as well as Morocco do not allow entry to non-Muslims.
ELEMENTARY: Different places have different rules about non-Muslims entering mosques. In most of the Arabian Peninsula and Morocco, non-Muslims cannot enter.
SECONDARY: The policy on admitting non-Muslims into mosques changes by region, but in most cases throughout the Arabian Peninsula and Morocco, entry is forbidden.
ADVANCED: Currently, rules about allowing non-Muslims into mosques differ, though mosques in the Arabian Peninsula and Morocco typically bar non-Muslim visitors, with few exceptions.

ADVANCED: At the age of twelve, Greg Ginn established Solid State Transmitters (SST).

COMPLEX: The 4th Alabama Infantry Regiment, led by Col. Egbert J. Jones of Huntsville, distinguished itself at the Battle of Manassas/Bull Run, the first major encounter of the American Civil War.

SECONDARY: Led by Colonel Egbert J. Jones, the 4th Alabama Infantry Regiment stood out during the Battle of Manassas/Bull Run, the first major Civil War clash.
ADVANCED: Commanded by Col. Egbert J. Jones of Huntsville, the 4th Alabama Infantry Regiment distinguished itself at the Battle of Manassas/Bull Run, the first major conflict of the American Civil War.

COMPLEX: In the early 1950s, the Ford Motor Company became a publicly traded corporation that was no longer entirely owned by members of the Ford family.

SECONDARY: During the early 1950s, Ford started trading publicly, so it wasn't exclusively owned by the Ford family anymore.
